description:
i visited this place long time ago ( at least 3-4years ). At that time, i loved this place because they had good selections of traditional Japanese food which were sooo good! Recently, i visited Fuji with my friends and they surprised me a lot. Now they have all traditional menu plus trendy japanese dishes too. their sashimi was all fresh, well plated, and good. i really loved their Toro with uni on top ( melted in my mouth with touch of truffle oil flavor). Service was also good, friendly and fast. i liked the waitress named 'K?' or 'kay' a lot!! i am not really sure her name but everything she recommended were so good. i definitely will go back to try their Toro. Oh, one more, their Beef teriyaki was sooooo good, too (i don't usually order beef teriyaki when i go to Japanese restaurant because i order only nigiri and sashimi, but my friend ordered one, and i tried) their Beef teriyaki is like premium steak quality! juicy tender and perfectly cooked. i highly recommend this place.

overall

food 5/5
service 5/5
price 5/5
interior (atmosphere) 2/5
location (parking) 3/5
author: Chris L.

description:
I've been here once before, several years ago and can vaguely recall that the sushi was OK. I came back tonight with a friend when they opened (they surprisingly got pretty busy!). 

We ordered the takoyaki to share, which I really enjoyed. I think it came with about 7 balls and more than enough bonito flakes, which I really appreciated. My friend ordered udon with tempura, which seemed to be packed with vegetables! It was a huge bowl. I ordered the chicken katsu curry, but either I forgot to include "curry" or the waiter misheard and my food ended up coming out separately. They were able to add curry as a side to my giant plate of katsu, though. It contained a lot of potatoes and carrots, which I appreciated; however, the curry itself was too thick. I like thick curry, but this was more like congealed liquid. It was barely fluid and was honestly kind of gross for me to look at. The breading on my katsu did not stay on the chicken itself, so maybe if they used different binding material, it would've been better. Portions were huge though and I had more than enough to take home for a second meal. 

The two servers were really nice, so that made up for the not so pleasant curry. Kind of. Would I return? Not likely, but then again, I felt the same way after my first experience.
author: Leslie C.

description:
We have been eating here since moving to Westportal. We eat sushi a lot and were absolutely surprised how good this sushi place was in a neighborhood not known to be culinarily adventurous. They have a wide variety of fish, which has always been fresh. There was a period that we ate here so many times a week it may as well have been our second kitchen.

We still eat here a lot but generally order out. The fish is always fresh. And the teriyaki dishes are also delicious. Just recently that the health scores have been low, but it's been super clean every time we've gone. If you feel like splurging and love sashimi, get the Omakase platter and let the sushi chef choose a great assortment of fish for you.
author: Angelito R.

description: Must go to this place! Excellent service and lots of food options! Great for vegetarians too! Try their firecracker dish, its an amalgam of great flavors! Price is fair for the location!
author: Mazda B.

description: First time visited this place. So far, one of the best sushi's ive ever had!! Crew was great, we came in right before they got busy. Definitely gonna visit again!!
author: Shena L.

description: I had lunch here with a gf and it was a great deal for really good food. I really enjoyed it and would definitely come back if I were in the area.
author: Chi N.

description: Always the perfect spot for a dinner or quick grab and go. My favorites are their dinner boxes and most of their rolls. Must try the seared sake toro with sauce! SOO goood! Customer service is amazing here!
author: Jenny V.

description: Tonight we had the most ridiculous dining experience at Fuji Japanese restaurant. We went there around 6:40 pm for dinner. Placed our order. After half an hour, our order has not arrived. When asked the waitress about that, she said it was late because they were short one cook in the kitchen so order would take longer to arrive. We patiently waited for another 30 minutes, the waitress finally came and told us the kitchen was closed and that we had to wait for another 20 minutes before we would have our foods. At the time, a whole hour had passed since we sat down at the restaurant. While we weren't sure if we would ever get your dinner if we would have stayed tonight, one thing for sure is that we will not return to this restaurant ever again!
author: M T.

description:
The crew at Fugi did a fantastic job! The fish was fresh and the dishes were creative. So glad this place is in our neighborhood. We gave the chefs a round of beer! Delicious and will be a regular. Cheers, Martin & Chris
PS: their takoyaki rivals the dishes found in Osaka! Try them!
author: Martin D.

description:
I had bookmarked Fuji to try for awhile now, and I'm bummed it took me so long to try it. This review is only for my Korean style Chirashi bowl, their service, and their price.

If you know what a Korean style chirashi bowl is, then sans perila/seasame leaf, this was legit.  Tons of quality sashimi, lots of veggies, and small bowl of rice. It made me miss my moms "hwe dup bap". I'd go back in a heartbeat just to get this dish.  My bf ordered California, Spider, and green dragon rolls and he said it was good. But nothing for him to say stellar, but he'd go back for sure.

Service was little slow. There were 2 sushi men making the rolls, and at least one or two back kitchen team, but one server. Granted we went close to 2pm, or there was a waitress shortage, service could've been better.  The waitress was sweet, kind, fast. Still, no way for her to cover the entire restaurant.

Price was reasonable. It's not a deal of the century, but it was sf price tag.

I am not sure of all of low reviews, I didn't read it, I don't think it's going to change my opinion much about now our regular spot.
author: S Y.

description:
The atmosphere is great, the place is very clean and the service was good. 

Today, I ordered Tori Karaage, Tonkatsu Curry, Spicy Tuna Roll, California Roll with Real Crabmeat, and Philadephia roll. 

My boyfriend and I thought the Tori Karaage sounded good because the description on the menu said it was marinated boneless chicken with spicy mayo. Sadly, it was pretty disappointing because it was just tiny pieces of fried chicken. The chicken wasn't marinated at all, it tasted like those popcorn chicken you order from Quickly's. It wasn't hot either. 

The Tonkatsu Curry, on the other hand, is very delicious. The curry was very flavorful and god I love the potatoes! 

The Spicy Tuna Roll was not disappointing at all. It was actually spicier than most Spicy Tuna Rolls I ever had. Which I am totally fine with that because I do LOVE spicy food. 

So, the menu gave an option to choose between California Roll with intimidation crabmeat for $6 or California Roll with REAL CRABMEAT for $7. Of course, I chose real crab meat! The California Roll was very big, but I didn't really like the crab meat it didn't seem that fresh...

Lastly, one of my favorite sushi rolls of all time is the Philadephia Roll. I must say, it's not one of the best I ever had. I love raw salmon but the salmon in the Philadephia Roll wasn't fresh. 

Overall, the place is okay but wouldn't be my go-to place for sushi rolls. The total of this entire dinner was $50, which is kind of pricey.
author: Kristi A.

description:
Great sushi! Everything at Fuji is excellent, from the sushi to the rib eye teriyaki and everything in between. 

The only bummer is the price! (Which, to be fair, is probably so high because the quality is so good... so take that with a grain of salt.) 

Fuji is not a fancy place by any means, but it's priced like one. Dinner for two is often $150, so even though this is our "neighborhood spot," we can't justify coming here very often. Wish we could though... because it's delish!
author: Megan B.

description: Love the salmon belly and torra truffle is so delicious... food is fresh. Customer service is great....
author: D Y.

description: i was looking for a sushi spot in the area, and my friend suggested this place. parking was kinda bad, but i really, really enjoyed this restaurant. the staff was great and helpful with suggestions, and the sushi rolls were terrific with a good selection of your standard rainbow, caterpillar rolls to more specialized. only 4 stars because one roll of ours came, and then had to wait awhile for the other 3 rolls to come.
author: Mike C.

description: I'm not sure why this restaurant has low stars, but we were happy customers! Sure, it's on the pricey side, but the rolls are fresh, flavorful, and unique. The mixed tempura was crispy and light, with 3 shrimp, zucchini, carrot, acorn squash, and potato. The philly roll was good, with large pieces of salmon and creamy avocado mixed with chilled cream cheese. The Godzilla roll was amazing with about 30 pieces of crispy garlic, tempura asparagus, and delicate red tuna. It was sensual and crunchy. The service was good too, many times our server and other waitresses checked in to make sure everything was good. They were friendly and welcoming. No wait on a Saturday at 6:30 too!
author: Lisa H.

description: I absolutely love Fuji from the sushi to even the udon. Everything I've tried is delicious! The Victoria secret roll is one of my favorites! It's so creative and having no rice and just fresh fish is amazing! I definitely recommend this place for all!
author: Fen S.

description:
I first went to Fuji's years ago and thought it was okay.  The portions were generous but the food was standard Japanese fare.  

For a recent family dinner we decided to give Fuji another try.  We were quickly greater upon our entrance and seated immediately.  The menu contains many of the greatest hits of Japanese food - donburi, sushi, sashimi, noodles, teriyaki, tempura, bento boxes, etc.  We decided to order the seafood yosenabe and one of their special sushi rolls.  

The yosenabe was full of seafood - mussels, clams, imitation crab, shrimp and salmon, along with vegetables and clear noodles.   The dish was flavorful and and hot, with the seafood cooked perfectly.   I had one issue with this dish and it was that the broth left me really thirsty, even though I did not find the dish salty.

The sushi roll was as expected and was quite large, so expect to share these.

Our meals came with a green salad.

Patrons seemed to be locals from the neighborhood.  On a weekend evening the restaurant was mostly full.  We were walk-ins.  Parking was plentiful nearby.  Service was good, with our waiter checking in on us, refilling our beverages and possessing a great attitude.

Fuji is a nice option for dining in West Portal but is similar to so many other Japanese restaurants in the area.
author: Melissa L.

description:
When I first walked in, the owner greeted me and made me feel right at home. The server was quick to give us suggestions and answer any questions I had about the menu. The entire staff was very kind and accommodating. 

The ambience is very pleasant! Warm and inviting with great music. Perfect for a first date or even a family dinner. 

I had a lion king roll and unagi hand roll. The sushi was very fresh and the rice was just the right consistency. Judging by how good my meal was, I am excited to try new rolls in the future. 

Highly recommend. If you live in SF or are visiting the West Portal area, definitely stop by and try the food here. This the place to be!
author: Corine C.

description:
This is our neighborhood go to spot for Sushi. Every time we come here if Shannon gives us great service. We ordered the Sashimi, UNI and rolls --the price is just right.

There seems never to be a wait at the bar, which is what I prefer.

I was here for the Warriors playoff game and he had the game on TV. I definitely will come back here for more Giants games this season. Keep up the good work and thank you for the good service!

5 stars!!
author: Jacky J.

description:
Soooo happy that Fuji is reopened again! I noticed that there's new chefs at the sushi bar and they're great. I've been here a few times are the reopening and it has been consistently good every time! I've brought a couple friends/coworkers here and they rave about this place and can't wait to come back!

The service is always great here, the servers are always attentive and they come check on how you're doing every so often.
author: Brittany L.

description:
This is our neighborhood go to spot for Sushi. Every time we come here if Shannon gives us great service. We ordered the Sashimi, UNI and rolls --the price is just right.

There seems never to be a wait at the bar, which is what I prefer.

I was here for the Warriors playoff game and he had the game on TV. I definitely will come back here for more Giants games this season. Keep up the good work and thank you for the good service!

5 stars!!
author: Lee L.

description:
Returned to Fuji shortly after they reopened, after they were closed by the health department for repeated vermin infestations and food safety violations, and operating without a valid health permit. 

The spicy tuna is always suspect, since that's where the oldest fish goes. Oddly, it's featured in many of their rolls. Since they've reopened, but the food prices have increased, the service has declined, and the food quality has become even more abysmal. 

Prior review:  Permit suspended. Serious or Repeated food safety violations. Vermin infestations. Operating without a valid health permit.
author: tout le monde a.

description: Great food great service top quality!!!!! Thanks Fuji for always delivering those dank eats!!!!  I recommend the snowy roll if you enjoy crab and their combination dinners are pretty large.  Always come here when I feel like Japanese!!!
author: Preston H.

description: Fuji never disappoints. I routinely come here with my girlfriend and they are so kind and hospitable. The sushi is huge and the flavors are on point. It never falls apart. Food is art, but they way they execute their sushi is phenomenal. It really is so beautiful. Thanks to the staff and chefs at Fuji for creating an amazing experience and giving us bomb dinner!
author: Ksenia A.

description:
A lot of money for a lot of nothing. 
First, I am usually very picky about sushi restaurants, but I was hungry and had a craving, so I was desperate.

We were sat to the side near the front which would usually mean a good spot for service, but sadly not. 

My girlfriend and I waited for 15 minutes from being seated, and had to flag down one of many waitstaff to finally order. No acknowledgment beforehand. 
My GF ordered beef teriyaki, and I, the sushi/sashimi combo. And then we waited.....and waited....and waited....
She got her plate first after about 20 minutes. I told her to start without me.  She was half way through before, yes...I had to flag down the staff again that never checked in on us. 
Finally...after another 20 minutes of waiting (so now we are at about 50 minutes since sitting) my sushi/sashimi combo came.

And it was stingy. For a  $23 dollar combo, it was really tiny.  
The tuna sashimi was half frozen still, and the yellow tail had a slight grayish tint to it. 
At this point I was starving, and ate it in 10 minutes flat. 
Then..I did the unthinkable. I ordered more food, because I was still hungry. 
They had a Crab leg special so I asked if they could provide it in a cone form, instead. The waitress insisted that they could do it that way, but it would just be the crab and rice.  She suggested if I wanted avocados and cucumber to just get a California roll with real crab. So that's what I did. 

And I waited...and waited....and waited....occasionally flagging down any Waiter or waitress that would acknowledge me. Meanwhile everyone around our table had been served promptly through several rounds of sushi. I would get a "Yes! I will check on it!" and watch as the waiter or waitress would run back and bring more sushi to other tables...

So....25 minutes later, I finally got my crab sushi...in a cone..not a roll as suggested. 

AWFUL SERVICE. RIP OFF SUSHI. HIGH PRICES. NOT REAL JAPANESE SUSHI. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME. GO TO J-TOWN AND GET THE REAL DEAL AT THESE PRICES.
author: Darren J W.

description: Very disappointing. Staff was neglectful, prices were high. Food was ok. First & last time for me at this restaurant.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I've been coming here for years and the food is usually good. Everything is usually delicious.... but I was surprised with my previous visit.  While the service was slow to get the food but quick to get you out, I decided to get a couple of rolls and my standard tako (octopus) nigiri.  The tako was horrible!  When I bit into it and it was a generous portion- all I tasted was water from it being frozen.... I had to chew watery octopus and could not spit it out because it would have been worst!  I went to the second piece and squeezed the tako where about a 1/4 of a cup of water came out of it.  No respectable sushi chef would have sent that out....
All the sushi places I go to - tako nigiri tells me how much I will go back or not. You now know my answer.
author: A. Marie L.

description:
I'm a West Portal native, and have been to Fuji before it mysteriously closed down.  I get it... making improvements to get your health score where it needs to be..

{{Incase you're not aware: Fuji had a big, glaring 'food safety' warning on their Yelp page}}.

Honestly, I've never had a problem with Fuji...it's a bit expensive, but it's good.

Until tonight :/

Came back for the first time since it's been re-opened.  I ordered (to go) two rolls of sushi and I waited about 30 minutes before getting there.  Then, I waited about 30 minutes - in their tiny front of house - with no service whatsoever.  Literally stood there looking around, trying not to disturb the people that were enjoying their meal inches away from me.

I don't have high expectations for 'to-go service' but come on, you guys are taking forever and I haven't even been able to pay for my bill in the meantime.

Service aside, the sushi was so lacking.  Easily could've paid 25% the price for super market sushi, and it still may have had more flavor.

I haven't given up on you yet Fuji, but you've got some decent competition in the area.  Your location and price suggest you're the superior option...Act like it.
author: Matt Q.

description:
What makes a restaurant great? 

1) The food
2) The service
3) The location
4) The restaurant itself

Fuji has all over the above and more! 

I am so happy that they reopened recently and that I finally dined here! One of my favorite things about this restaurant is that it is family owned. I have a business with my family and value family business' so much. Why? Because you know the people actually love what they do when they work there and don't just hire a bunch of people to run the show. Shannon, one of the owners, is extremely nice and so friendly. She made my mom and I feel like we were her special customers of the day. She is the head waitress and her brother is behind the sushi bar. Speaking of the bar, I LOVE that Fuji had a wide array of beers on tap and not just the typical 2 or 3 beers that other Japanese restaurants have. The food is delicious and the fish is super fresh! The restaurant is clean and I love how modern (and clean) the bathroom is - this is huge because I feel as though there are many times the restaurant will be nice and clean, but as soon as you enter the bathroom, you think twice about dining there again! This place gets busy so my tip is to call ahead and try to make a resey. Can't wait to dine here again!
author: Anastasia N.

description: Ok now I been a big fan of sushi  and I I found this one sir on Geary and 10th called I love sushi but it closed down and me and my brother went out and tried almost every single sushi spot in sf and came across Fuji. Hands down the place is real good. They can have all my money . Sushi be fresh although I don't mess with the raw stuff but friends that come with me enjoy it a lot . Fuji hands landed a place in my heart .   Staff are real nice and friendly. My dry as friend Ben likes this one lady here but he super shy. Lol #Paypaboy
author: Donald A.

description: This is a decent sushi bar with a good vibe. The sushi itself was carefully decorated. You can tell the sushi chefs are actaully putting their effort into making your dishes. However, the wait time is kinda of long. I guess they are spending too much time to make your meal. Come only if you're not too hungry already.
author: Christian W.

description: I've been going for years. For some reason the food was not as good as in the past. The service was excellent.  However I kept seeing tiny flies flying around. They need to do something about the little flies. The tuna and salmon were more fishy than usual. The udon with beef and 49er roll were good. I will try this place again in a month and hopefully they have improved on the fish quality and tiny flies.
author: John K.

description: Yet another poor food safety score notification-this is the second time in about 3 years.
author: Luisa T.

description:
Really great presentation. Beautiful Sushi.

I didn't get the feeling it wasn't clean inside...

Our server was super nice and attentive.

For appetizer I hot the Hawaiian Poke.  It was good. Not the most flavorful tuna I've ever had but was till a tasty treat. Nice sauces.

We got the Bagel Roll, Tanzania Roll, Samurai Roll, and the Dinosaur Foot. All were beautiful.  And all tasted good.  The dinosaur roll was super complex - maybe too complex? But still tasty.  Definitely didn't need to add ginger or wasabi. It was hard to eat though - I had to use my hands! All the others were good. Tasted fresh.

The only real problem is they were out of the Torpedo IPA on tap, which was sad, cause there was really no other micro brew choice.  Oh well.
author: Sarah C.

description:
First time here and man for a local sushi place this place was bangin. Service was great of course very attentive and attractive servers. Nice young hip vibe for west portal which was a great addition because west portal is very uppity and super modern. Nice to come to a place that was homey. 

Recommendations: 
Godzilla roll
Uni Aji
striped bass
And a kanpachi 

This isn't super high end so don't come here with that mentality, but if you love good fish for a good price and a nice conversation with the very interactive sushi chef come on by fuji for your sushi fix!
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
I'm giving this place 2 stars mostly because of how it used to be. My partner and I used to go there almost weekly because the sushi was yummy and they had a great sake list. There were a few servers there who were fabulous but who have since left. I can remember numerous times getting great recommendations and having a wonderful time there.

Things started to go downhill when we came in and had a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We should've picked up on the vibe when we walked in and half of the tables were not bussed and covered in dirty dishes. The waiter was doing his best, trying to multitask working essentially by himself. He did a great job and I commend him for still taking time to deliver good service to us. What bothered me was a random guy (who I can only assume was in charge or the owner's son or something) came in and started yelling at the waiter. We had to overhear him (he made no effort to conceal his annoyance) yelling at our waiter for most of our lunch. He made no effort to help clean up or serve. In fact he actually made the restaurant slow down. It totally soured us to this place.

We haven't been back since. It's a shame because we went there consistently for 2 years.
author: J M.

description:
Came across this sushi restaurant after an appointment and just walked in for dinner. I have to say this is one of the "sushit" restaurants and the worst I have had so far. 

Why so bad if you ask? We ordered the Lion King roll, a bowl of Ramen and another roll (can't remember the name exactly, it is the pinkish roll). First of all, I asked our waitress if the Ramen broth is Tonkatsu and she said yes because I wanted a Tonkatsu ramen so I ordered it. The Ramen broth was by no means a Tonkatsu broth when it arrived. It was very plain, cleared, and lack of any flavor broth. Our waitress worked at a Japanese restaurant and didn't even understand what a Tonkatsu broth was! I won't even call that a bowl of ramen, but just a regular noodle soup with boring veggies and broth.

Our Lion King roll was so miserably layered by a deep sea of thick mayonnaise on the top. I usually like mayonnaise on a sandwich and sushi as well, but seriously put a ton on sushi was pretty bad. The pinkish roll had so much rice and rolled with tasteless fish was also a mistake. We literally took two bites and left our foods at the restaurants and hungry still. I don't consider myself a picky eater but this restaurant was off the list. At the end, our bill was about $50 and all went to waste.
author: Lena H.

description: The service is Great here at Fuji, the food was questionable in the past but since the new management/owner reorganize and remodeled the place the quality of food improved drastically.  The menu have array of things to choose from for all different appetite from vegan to meat eater and everyone in between.  I usually have sashimi every time and I find the fish very fresh, also the rolls are very tasty combination of fresh and cooked ingredients.  Over all a Great Neighborhood Gem.
author: Thomas H.

description: Was in the mood for chicken karaage. So I ordered the karaage appetizer with a bowl of rice. Very tasty and delish. My husband ordered the veggie ramen. There were barely any noodles in it which was disappointing. But when we told the waiter, he told us he would give us half off. Would have preferred a new bowl with more noodles but at least they offered to do something about it. Pretty pricey for regular items. Would go to sushi suki for sushi and sashimi instead.
author: Di G.

description: Solid sushi. Had dinner here twice in our short stay in SF. The sushi was fresh, delicious, and just right. The staff was friendly and the food came out quickly. I was afraid the food in SF would make me miss NYC sushi, but this was not the case. It was better than many sushi bars back home. Very impressed and will definitely be back!!
author: Karina S.

description: I visited Fuji today, with the intention or ordering lunch. There were two people at two tables and the restaurant wasn't very busy. While sitting to be waited on another couple arrived and were offered water and beverages immediately. I had to flag down the waitress to order a drink and meal. I got up and left due to poor service. The waitress and the people behind the counter treated me as if I wasn't in their restaurant. Needless to say I will not be returning.
author: Mina N.

description: Feel like this review is long overdue. We've been coming here on a weekly basis since they reopened and every time was fresh and delicious. Had a great time here again last night thanks to Shannon and the chefs! We couldn't ask for better service and the food was amazing. We love how they have many good choices of kitchen food (so good pairing with drinking beer lol) along with their good selection of fishes and sushi and sake =). AND they had all the games on!! Love this place! We'll be back soon!
author: Wes Z.

description: This restaurant deserves much higher reviews! The Poke appetizer & grilled squid is amazing.Great Uni & Ikura! The quality of fish is amazing and the service was friendly. Wish they didn't play top hits but that's my only complaint.
author: Candece S.

description:
Fuji is a small, cozy Japanese restaurant. If you're here for good sushi, try some of the special rolls, including Finding Nemo and the Firecracker.  Between my friend and me, we were full after four rolls (Finding Nemo, Firecracker, Futo Maki, Baked Scallop). 

We both felt the baked scallop was generous with the scallops but way too heavy on the creamy sauce (is it mayo?), which overwhelmed the natural taste of the scallops and sushi itself. We loved the Firecracker, which was lightly fried with tempura batter and had delicious salmon inside. If the Firecracker was too guilty and calorific for you, then the Finding Nemo roll will cleanse your palate with its fresh salmon taste.

The waiters were especially attentive and nice, so two thumbs up for good customer service.
author: Joanne K.

description:
Fuji has reopened and is even better now! We've loved this spot for years for great Japanese food. The staff was very friendly and attentive, the food arrived quickly, and was delicious down to the last grain of rice. 

We're so glad they're back, we've missed them.
author: Art R.

description:
We've finally found a decent Japanese restaurant in S.F. outside the Japantown and Downtown areas. My wife, son and I lived in Japan longer than the U.S., and we're hard to please. We've gotten used to the typical beef teriyaki and tempura combo bento, the odd, only-in-America rolls, etc., that you find in California, but the flavor/seasoning is not always right, or the price is too high for standard fare, etc.
Not at Fuji. The chicken katsu curry I had was cooked right, the coating coming off a bit but not too much in the sauce, the vegetables in the curry in the right proportion, and fukujin-zuke! I never expected it would be so hard to find properly made and served Japanese curry in Northern California, but it is hard to find--look no longer, it's made right at Fuji.
The Finding Nemo was the sort of roll we'd seldom see in Japan, but that's OK--it was made well and tasted great. It was similar to the Rainbow Roll we get at Sushi to Dai For in San Rafael, but with spicy maguro in the middle.
My wife and son also greatly enjoyed their combo bentos. They are at least as hard to please as me, but the consensus was five stars!
author: John K.

description: The Ramen bowl was full of fresh tasty goodness! We also enjoyed a nice plate of thinly sliced ribeye and salad Tataki YUM!
author: C. R.

description: My boyfriend took me there for lunch yesterday. The first thing that caught my attention  was the indoor decoration which is pretty good. The  service was great. I liked the fire crackers the most. My boyfriend had ramen soup which was okay. It didn't impress us much. I would definitely recommend getting the fire crackers if you visit there.
author: Abby K.

description: Best neighborhood gem in West Portal! we recently rediscovered Fuji and so glad we did.  Love their food!  The sashimi dishes are fresh, delicious and served with generous portions.  The clam ramen is yummy, the hamachi kama and shishamo are prepared perfectly, the appetizers and the special rolls are delicious.  All the servers are attentive and professional.  This place gets full very quick, so wait time can be a bit if arrive after 6pm weekdays.
author: Marie H.

description: Ordered some to-go from here and I was pretty happy that they were so prompt with my order. Friendly service. Sushi was great! Loved how spicy it was :)
author: Candy L.

description: I used to frequent this restaurant in my 20s.  Escaping the heat of the East Bay I decided to bring some family in.  The service was mediocre but got better as they tried to make room for incoming customers.   The spicy ramen was flavorful and full of seafood,  steak teriyaki was bland and sake donburi unfilling. Requested ice water that had about 2 dots of ice and my water was warm.  Ugh!  Tried dessert and waited an additional 15 - 20min.  Too pricey for what we dealt with. No need to return.
author: REBECCA S.

description:
For the sake of how long I've been living in this area, I'm really surprised I never decided to walk into this restaurant until a few days ago. It isn't very visually appealing and can be easily missed on the corner, but once you're in it's actually pretty cozy like you're at a local cafe.

On a weekend this place was just the right amount of crowded, meaning that my sister, mom and I didn't have to wait long for a table even though there were a few parties ahead of us and people leaving the restaurant. Now onto the food; the prices overall are a little steep, but in the end it was pretty worth it for the amount of food you get. My sister got the tempura donburi, I got the dinner bento box two and my mom got the bento box three. All the dinner menu items come with miso soup and salad (PS salad dressing is yummy); bento boxes get a side of rice. We also decided to order a "Finding Nemo" roll (spicy tuna, salmon, avocado, roe) that came out way later while we were in the middle-almost end of our main dishes... I don't know if I would order both dinner items and sushi rolls if they don't come out at the same time.

Anyways, I LOVED my bento box two; came with salmon teriyaki, a decent portion of tuna and salmon sashimi (these were FAT pieces and probably one of the places I can recommend for very fresh fish), shrimp and veggie tempura, and this side of spinach with ponzu sauce. The bento box three my mom got had two skewers of yakitori, an eggplant side, veggie tempura and california roll. Both boxes were about $17-$19 which isn't too bad for what you're getting.

Downside of my experience: they weren't on top of refilling our waters or asking if everything was okay. I would definitely come back for the sashimi , but maybe to-go this time. ALSO pay cash for 10% off your bill!
author: Kathleen S.

description: I love their sashimi here! Always fresh tasting. Service is a plus here they always accommodate me and check in often. Will definitely come back for more.
author: Elise T.

description:
Had a craving for sashimi and sake after work one day so met up a friend at this local spot. Hostess was polite and asked if we wanted to be seated at the bar or table. We opted for the bar because we could watch the chef prepare our order.

We ordered a variety of sashimi and started off with some sake and appetizers. Didn't have to wait long before we got our food and the presentation was amazing. It was a work of art and more importantly the sashimi was fresh. They were large generous cuts compared to other places. My favorite was probably the lobster sashimi.

You eat with your eyes first and they definitely had me there. We ended staying pretty long drinking sake afterwards. The wait staff was on point making sure we had everything we needed. 

Not sure why some of the reviews are low on this place but this place definitely is thumbs up.
author: David H.

description: We went for lunch and both got lunch combo boxes. Both were good and more food than we expected. We will be going again when in the area.
author: Ali P.

description:
Came for lunch with a friend on a quiet Friday afternoon. We went about 30 minutes after opening so we were easily seated. We found metered parking, it wasn't difficult at this time.

We were craving basic Japanese food and sushi and ordered the Tori Karaage, Dinosaur Foot* and Lion King, and Cali Rolls. These were all great and I recommend them all. *The Dino Foot had huge helpings of spicy tuna, so anti spicy fam, be warned.

We had tea and it was consistently refilled by an attentive waiter. I can appreciate the attentiveness. We didn't have to wait long for them to process the bill either. The service we received was nice and comfortable, neither hovering nor neglecting.

Overall, I think this is a great spot for catching up or satisfying a sushi craving.
author: Brenda L.

description: I asked my sister for a quality Japanese dinner for my meal before I left for college and we came across this place. The server was extremely friendly and even asked us what music we wanted to listen to. As for the food, it is a bit pricy, but the portions are kingly and the taste high end.
author: Marcus P.

description:
Fuji has definitely gone down hill since its reopening. I've been back here twice since and the first time back was better than the second but I went there with family members on Sunday and it was clear to me that the food and service are very much compromised; I don't even know if it's the same ownership! different cooks, waiters, everything!

For starters, I wanted the combination box number one; teriyaki chicken/mixed tempura with a few pieces of tuna sashimi, sushi with wasabi on the side and something that are like fried wantons or pot stickers that I didn't care for and white rice.

I had that specific meal on my previous trip to Fuji and thought it would be an almost perfect combination if I could get all shrimp tempura as I don't care that much for most of the vegetable except for the broccoli but love shrimp tempura. So I asked the waiter if I could get that box with all shrimp tempura, even for an additional price and he said "sure, no problem" He then took everyone else's orders as they were ready to order. I felt reassured that I would get my meal the way I wanted it and waited patiently in anticipation for my food. 

When the waiter finally arrived with the food, I saw him putting what looked like my box down at someone else's seat but saw it had mixed tempura and thought maybe they ordered the same thing as me without all shrimp. then he put her box down in front of me which was all wrong as items on both plates were in the wrong box and my all shrimp tempura missing entirely. We point out the items that were wrongly placed in each box and the waiter says "let me fix that for you" and rearranges the two boxes and I point out that I ordered all shrimp tempura with my box as it was the first thing ordered and he just kept saying "let me fix that for you" so I assumed that he was going to bring me my shrimp tempura, but just goes off attending to his other tables as I begin to eat my meal. It becomes evident to me after a while that he is not bringing any shrimp and kept passing our table without checking in to ask if we needed anything. 

I finally flagged down another waitress and explained that I had ordered all shrimp tempura with my meal and that our waiter never brought me my shrimp. She tells me that shell bring me more shrimp tempura when it didn't matter anymore. I was just about done with everything else on my plate. twenty minutes after I finished the rest of my food, she brings me "two" shrimp tempuras and I had to save a bit of my Sapporo for a good ten minutes to wash it down and not have to order another one. the original box comes with a plate of tempura with only "one" shrimp tempura and about six vegetable. I was expecting five to seven shrimp but of course my whole order was messed up. 

Aside from all of that, my teriyaki chicken wasn't very good either. the chicken tasted somewhat rubbery and I bit into two unidentifiable hard pieces that I had to spit out into a napkin and there was almost no teriyaki sauce either! just minimal on the chicken, but I have ordered teriyaki dishes many times at the previous Fuji and I was always able to mix the white rice and soak up the sauce with my rice; I have even ordered extra rice before and this time I couldn't soak up any sauce with my rice at all. We ordered a plate full of California rolls  with real crab meat to be shared and they were just okay. the miso and salad were good but that hardly redeems the mostly mediocre food and bad service.

What pisses me off is that when you go out to eat, you go out to enjoy yourself and when a waiter or whoever brings you the wrong thing, all you can think about is how they screwed up your order and you can't enjoy your meal. the first waiter should have went straight to the kitchen and explained his own mistake, the chefs mistake or any other confusion and prioritized fixing my order, but the first waiter did nothing but mislead me into thinking he would fix my order ASAP but literally did nothing to make things right. 

If it were up to me I would never go back to Fuji and find a better Japanese restaurant in the area or in San Francisco! there has to be plenty of them that are much better in San Francisco of all places, but I'm never the one to choose where we go out and eat.
author: David A.

description: They charge $1 per person for hot tea!  At a Dim Sum place maybe  but I have not encountered that for lunch.  Is this something new?  It wasn't super special tea or anything.    The lunch for three people was $60 after tip and tax.  I had one rainbow roll, my friend had a hamachi Kama and a three item combo.  It seemed really expensive for what we ordered.  I do understand it is hard for restaurants to make ends meet but I didn't feel I got my money's worth.  The food was fine.  I'm not sure I would come back.
author: Karen R.

description: Closed at 2.30 on Saturday. But it supposed to be open all day. Please correct your hours of operations
author: Artem T.

description: This was the worst tasting sushi ever! We totally loved the old place. This new ownership is completely sub standard. Save your money...
author: Ellen F.

description:
I don't do many reviews any more and hesitate to write bad ones but I wouldn't go here again. There is nothing to recommend the place except they seem to keep long hours. The flavors were dull and prices were a little steep for what you got. I ordered the oyako-donburi and it resembled none I'd had before, and not in a good way. 

With so many good Japanese places in SF, I'd give Fuji a pass. Unless nothing else is open.
author: jim b.

description:
Tried this place after a morning run and ordered the sashimi salad for lunch, really refreshing and light, just perfect...  My husband order a Katsu rice and it was good.  When our bill came, we were charged dinner prices, so check your bill carefully.  The waitress forgot? She apologized and rectified our bill.

Will return, since it's in our neighborhood
author: Elaine Y.

description:
You've got to be kidding--I thought our server was a standup comedian moonlighting in a Japanese restaurant.

But her timing was off, and she wasn't all that funny.  Still, I had a hard time believing that she wanted to charge me $2.00 for some tamari sauce (wheat-free soy sauce that maybe cost the restaurant 8 cents for a two-ounce serving).

I have wheat allergies and so I was asking in order not to get congested sinuses.

I asked to see the manager and she informed me she was the manager.

Well, she's managed to get four one- and two-star reviews since the restaurant re-opened.

After this experience with the magical $2.00-a-serving tamari, I can see why people don't like this place too much anymore.
author: David G.

description: Mediocre food, arrogant service, disrespectful staff. If you want to have a good time, go somewhere else.
author: Deb M.

description:
We met my mother-in-law at this restaurant for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. When we get there my mother-in-law is standing outside and tells us "they don't serve lunch." I look at the neon sign that says Open. I peek inside and see sushi chefs and one table of customers eating. Uhm, they serve food right?

We decide to go in and after 5 minutes, a grumpy waitress emerges from the back. She motions for us to sit down. I look at the menu and one section says "Lunch Specials" which are not available on Sundays so I figure there is just some miscommunication. Ok fine. 

The waitress comes to take our order and I say, "chicken teriyaki and tempura bento" as I gesture to a lunch bento (not in lunch specials). She says " no we don't serve lunch." Oh, no bentos? No lunch. Huh? She tells me you can only order from the dinner menu. Same items just larger and more expensive portions. Fine, dinner bento. I am already seated.

Another couple comes in and requests a table for 6. The waitress tells them, "no table for 6" (The whole restaurant is empty around us). They asked if she could put two tables together and the waitress says no so the couple leaves.

This waitress could care less. Fuji needs to do themselves a favor and hire new waitstaff. The food was fine.
author: vicki c.

description:
Delicious Japanese restaurant, but a little pricier, and prepare to wait for your food!

Favorite items were:
Korean style Chirashi: nom nom nom! Korean style basically means the fish is chopped up smaller and it came with a ton of lettuce. I liked this, as it was sort of a combo sashimi salad/chirashi, but my BF did not like that the fish was cut up into small pieces. Pass on the spicy sauce - use Wasabi!
Fried baby octopus appetizer: the baby octopus are a little salty, but great flavor! Came with salad to balance out the oilines of the octopus
Double hamachi roll - hamachi on the inside... hamachi on the outside! No seaweed in this roll, which made it easier to eat. Creamy avocado and sweet sauce was super flavorful as well

The OK:
Finding nemo roll - spicy tuna no the inside, salmon and avocado on the outside. decent, but not my favorite!!

Again - it takes them a while to serve you here. They seemed to have a TON of togo orders, with only 2 waitresses and 2 sushi chefs. It wasn't too crowded... but it seemed that every aspect of service dragged on.

Come here if you don't mind the wait!!
author: Michelle L.

description: I love eating here at fuji's! The fish is always fresh, the fried/cooked food is on point! The best part... they got this blond chick working here that's hella fine.
author: Brian P.

description:
The beautiful touches of Japanese ambiance are gone. This place was divine. From the people to your dinnerware. Wow, in West Portal really; maybe, I said maybe, this ownership has quality good enough for a strip mall, but not West Portal. 
Fuji used to make these beautiful gourmet rolls that would engulf you into an extremely satisfying delicious experience. I must of been there 100 times and every time it was a scrumptious encounter of delicacies. 
All gone. 
When I would pay cash I would save 10%; that was a great deal, especially since the prices used to be moderate. 
The tableware used to be authentic Japanese art. The walls told a story ; a story of culture. 
Behind the Sushi chefs there was a collection of tastefully placed Saki bottles; all gone, in place of Saki bottles, it is now shelving for cleaning supplies like rolls of paper towels. 
I'm a little saddened and in search of a new place to experience a Japanese meal.
author: Javi V.

description: Excellent Sushi here! We first went to Fuji a few years ago for the Christmas holiday and it definitely did not disappoint.  From their Sushi platters to their teriyaki dinner plates, portions are very generous, but more importantly, all ingredients are fresh and of the highest quality. Service is excellent as well - friendly and attentive staff!  A hidden gem in West Portal. Highly recommended!
author: Mike N.

description:
Preface: I used to live in Japan.

Meal ordered: Dinner Box #4
Cleanliness of the restaurant: 5/5
Service: 5/5 - fast, polite, gave an accurate measure of how long it would take for the food to be prepared.
To-go packaging: 5/5

Sushi: 5/5 - spicy tuna roll
Tempura: 5/5 good variety, crisp, though the dipping sauce was not that great (it was essentially watered down soy sauce).
Yellow Tail: 4/5 a little overcooked (it was not marinaded, glazed, or seasoned).
Croquette: 0/5 It was runny liquefied mashed potato mix that doesn't come close to actual croquettes, it was inedible (-1 star). Plus, they did not serve it with katsu sauce, rather some unidentifiable brown sauce with chunks of fat floating at the top.
Salad: 2/5 fresh, but they use iceberg lettuce, I may as well drink a glass of water.
Miso soup: 2/5 tastes like a shiro/aka blend, leaning more towards the shiro. The flavor tasted like the packets you buy from the store as opposed to homemade miso.

The total for the Dinner Box ($21) and the croquette was $29.95 after tax. As far as the contents of the Dinner Box itself (purely objectively), the price is pretty average. 

As a whole, I was not particularly impressed with the food. They have a stereotypical menu and the quality is clearly hit or miss depending upon the dish. I feel like they cut *some* corners because this is SF and people here do not know what un-Americanized Japanese food tastes like (-1). Croquettes are one of my favorite sides to order at a Japanese restaurant (yes I am aware that this is not a Japanese dish, rather a French one) because the Japanese style of making croquettes is positively delicious! So when I got home and had a bite of one of the croquettes and had to question if they actually served me croquettes... I was rather irked to say the least.

If I return it will be for the sushi and the superior service only because the spicy tuna roll I had was *very* good and the wait staff was really awesome!
author: Leah C.

description: Seems like service is really slow. I had to ask for my status of my take order twice. It was only three sushi rolls after waiting 30 minutes and it wasn't as if it was busy. Not a good way to get customers to return. Got my sushi and It literally was just average. Not impressed. They didn't even apologize nor didn't offer me tea as I waited.
author: Andrew M.

description: Really disappointing reopening.  The service is terrible - they're either understaffed or just too slow. We ordered a lot of sashimi:  most of it was bland, some of it was actually kind of bad.  The ankimo was terrible. The special banana split roll was cold and small and didn't taste as good as before the closure (for safety concerns).  This used to be a neighborhood fave, but now I'll probably never come here again.
author: Athos K.

description:
We were surprised and disappointed when Fuji shut down to health safety violations and were looking forward to the reopening.  We returned for the 1st time last weekend.  My son says that the owners have changed, but the workers looked to be the same (I don't believe the cooks are the same - see below).  I was happy to see a 5-star review thinking that it improved.  Sadly, I have to disagree as there are a number of things that bothered us about the reopening.

First, there is a new menu with new higher prices.  The dishes we routinely order increased by as much as $4 if not more.  To us, it seems like they were trying to recapture whatever loss income they suffered during the closure and/or to pass off the costs of the upgrade onto their loyal clientele who made it neighborhood success.  

Second, the increased prices did not translate to better value or better food.  In fact, I thought the quality of the food and the taste was not as good as before the closure.  Did they change chefs? Are they skimping on the quality of the ingredients to make more money?  The chicken tasted more processed. The tonkatsu portions were smaller than before.

Third, while it was an established restaurant, we had a mediocre experience while dining there.  They seemed disorganized; they didn't acknowledge the customers who were waiting; they didn't have enough menus; they didn't have everything listed on the menu, and the list goes on.  It felt like it was a brand new restaurant (which in a way it is after being shuttered for 4 months) and that it opened too early before working out the kinks.  Service was average.

Fourth, they also got rid of the discount if you paid by cash instead of credit card.

All in all, it was a disappointing return.  I would have expected them to treat their clients better especially for those who have supported them over the years and who waited for them to reopen after the health violations.  During its closure, we were forced to find and try other Japanese restaurants in the area and we founds some very good ones.  I'm sure we'll return because of its convenience and to give it another chance.  But all the things above may keep us from making it a regular visit (we used to come at least once every couple of weeks if not more).
author: Will L.

description: it was very good exprience at fuji. I saw servers and customers talk and interact each others well! Best service! and quality of fish ! is so fresh !  I am happy that i chose Fuji for my dinner! I would definitely go back! :)
author: Pahaha K.

description: Excellent lunch choice. Good value with reasonable quslity sushi. Friendly service. Nice view of West Portal neighborhood/street from most tables with large glass windows.
author: Joe S.

description: It was clean and customer service was great, but the choice of the plates i had were not the best. Rolls were ok, but not the best. Appetizers, the octopus balls did not taste fresh, they seemed frozen, a bit too soggy, although they were fried.
author: Leticia Z.

description:
Don't let the above one check-in fool you, I go here whenever am able to. Fresh seafood is pretty much my criteria at a Japanese restaurant and they have it. The menu is also extensive but has more familiar items if you're not adventurous. I usually do a mix of both (sweet shrimp, toro, giant clams, sashimi) and would discover an item to order the next time!

The owners put in effort considering this is a location for SF-natives - none of the constant foot traffic found elsewhere. As a result, prices tend to be higher than the average Japanese restaurant but still not wallet busting.

Very convenient to get to if you're anywhere near the southwestern part of SF. There's no need to trek all the way to other parts of the City or Japantown. There is an upstairs dining area for large groups like on birthdays. This is one of my favorite restaurants of any cuisine in the City. The extra star is for our server Shannon, and friendly Kay.
author: Peter L.

description:
Too bad this place wasn't closer to home as we need a great Japanese restaurant in my city!  I have been here several times with a family friend for lunch but this is the first time I've been here for dinner with friends.  My friend made reservations and we sat upstairs, and I didn't even know there was seating upstairs.  The portions and food were superb in my book.  But I just can't get over the ratings of this place are all over the charts, from 1-5.  I rate it a five as we ordered various dishes, hamachi appetizer, fried scallops, seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll, Combo dinner #1 and #2 and all were delicious!  We particularly like the combo dinners as the sashimi was fresh with 6 slices of fish, 3 salmon and 3 tuna, 2 shrimp tempuras and vegetable tempura, salmon teriyaki (combo 2), chicken teriyaki (combo 1), gyoza (combo 1) and the combos were under $20.  Combos come with soup, salad and rice.

Service was attentive as well and if you pay your bill in cash, you get 10% off your bill.
author: Karen W.

description:
My favorite sushi joint :) I discovered shiso leaves here and I love the aroma! Not many places incorporate shiso leaf in their rolls.

Fresh fish
Hot sake
Excellent service
Cozy spot to unwind with friends
Reasonable price

What more can you ask for? It's a staple in my food book.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Came here upon a recommendation for lunch on a Friday afternoon.

It wasn't too busy, but service was SLOW.

The menu is decent, lots of options.

Looking for Mango: Very beautiful dish, the sweet sauce and mango added a nice dimension to the roll, but did slightly overpower the soft taste of the shrimp.

Snowy: Another pretty dish, but very much lacked any flavor depth.

Spicy Tuna: Nothing to write home about here. Simple presentation, very VERY mild Tuna, I didn't find it spicy at all and I am known for being a Spice-Whimp. 

They did have a Lychee Rice Wine/ Sake which we LOVED. 

Over all, this place didn't live up the hype and the freshness/ flavor didn't live up to the pretty presentations. 

Not a fav, probably wouldn't be returning.
author: Meghan L.

description:
The Cherry Blossom roll I got, had so much rice and rolled with tasteless and OLD tuna fish. Salmon was chewy and with layer of fat. Generally when you smell the fish on your plate it is a big NO NO, I could smell the fish the moment plate landed on y table. I literally took two bites and left my food at the restaurants. Waiter was nice but not professional enough to ask me why I left my plate full of food!!!!
My other order was veggie gyoza and it was good.

I would also question cleanliness at Fuji's..  The tables are sticky and the chairs are sticky & dirty. Seriously, this place hasn't been cleaned or maintained well.  

Food is mediocre at best.
I don't consider myself a picky eater but this restaurant is now off the list.
author: Anna S.

description: We always come here because my parents are quite the regulars! The owner is super sweet and is very good with my parents! We have a big family so always upstairs! We get a ton of sushi! It's gets crowded so make your reservations! Parking is ehhhhh but I always get lucky! The sushi is so good just like the service! You must try the shashimi! Sp? Lol
author: Angel G.

description: Love this place! The food is fresh and delicious. My second time around I discovered some new rolls that I absolutely love. I highly recommend ordering the Dino Foot, Liger and the Finding Nemo Roll. The presentation was on point and everything full of flavor. Sushi craving satisfied!
author: Ashley S.

description: Got takeout and thought it was great. Came months later and the ramen we got was cold but had no clue it was supposed to be that way. Miso had no flavor, but salad was good. Waiter would be on the phone when talking to us, super disappointed! :/
author: Ali S.

description:
This meal was so disappointing. Fuji is within walking distance of our new house so we were so hopeful that it would be as amazing as the reviews indicate. It was pretty busy when we arrived, but we were able to snag the last available table. After that, everything went downhill.

It took us forever to be greeted by our server, then to have our order taken and our order took even longer. As for the rolls, the only one we liked had such heavy cream on it that we had to scrape most of it off. As for the others, one of the sauces made it completely inedible and scraping the sauce off didn't change that. On top of everything, things tasted pretty fishy. 

Maybe it will be better if we try it again, but not sure when we'll feel like doing so.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I went to Fuji with my boyfriend.
We sometimes come to west portal and never saw this place.
At first, I saw this place from yelp and they got tree and a half star, my boyfriend didn't need to try but I asked him.
We ordered lunch special and sushi.
It's so good. It better than some 4-5 star Japanese restaurant yelp review.
The waitress is so nice.
The food came slow but good quality.
We will come to visit here next time.
author: Naomi N.

description:
When I first tried Fuji's years ago, I remember thinking that the food was solid but pricey.  Since then, I've been back a handful of times and each trip has been less and less satisfying.  I don't know if it's because the food just isn't as good as it was back then, or if it's because I've found better places to go to, but my opinion of Fuji has decreased as their prices have stayed the same.

On this most recent trip, I ended up bringing my family here to grab dinner.  Since I had already eaten sushi/sashimi for lunch, I decided to go with Bento Box Combo #4 with Gyoza, Grilled Yellowtail, Mixed Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4Dx_LtGrciojBXixDZoCvw?select=wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA#8hOI5jUQqoc3hrLiBWRQmA) and a Hamachi Nigiri (even though it was already a lot of food, I couldn't resist my favorite).  At $21.95, it's not a cheap dinner combination, but you do get a nice variety of food.  While there were little things here and there that I liked, the food was mostly just okay.

Out of the bunch, the Grilled Yellowtail tasted the best to me, but it wasn't anything you can't get elsewhere.  Sadly, there wasn't anything special about the Mixed Tempura either, and the only notable about the Gyoza was how the skin was so crispy (which I liked0.  Since I'm rather indifferent when it comes to Spicy Tuna rolls, it's hard for me to say how good/bad it was, but I was impressed with how it actually had some heat behind it.  As for the Hamachi Nigiri (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4Dx_LtGrciojBXixDZoCvw?select=wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA#wadxpCwcxh79uf9UzRfuYA), they were generous with the size of the cut, but I've had better (and worse).

From my prior experiences, the rolls/sashimi and appetizers are probably the way to go.  Some of the rolls are pretty good and unique to them, but the rest of what I've had isn't all that special.  Nothing bad, but nothing remarkable.  Fuji is great for the neighborhood but for that kind of money, I feel like I can spend the same on something better or get the same quality somewhere else for less.
author: Mike L.

description: Closed by health department.  Sign on the door says closed for renovation but the health department sticker is up saying it is closed due  to repeated violations and infestation. Also, operating without a health permit
author: Sandy M.

description:
Talk about service! My fiance and I wanted some sushi for dinner and picked this place to try out. After walking through the cramped entrance, we signed our names under the wait list. We were 4th down the list and the place were quite packed. We only waited about 5 minutes. Along with that, the waiters and waitress were very quick, but surprisingly pleasant to speak to. I'd say that's top notch for me. There was a mistake in our order and it was quickly taken and replaced without any issues or attitude. For me, the service is 5 stars. The only reason I gave 4 stars in my review is because of the food.

The food was good and delicious, but forgettable. It did the job on satisfying a sushi craving. We had some tokiyaki, tempura calamari, Ebi Girl Roll, and I believe the finding Nemo roll. All of them were good and delicious. No soy sauce nor wasabi needed when eating it because of the abundant toppings. The finding Nemo had a slight spicy kick to it and the Ebi Girl has a crunch to it. The tokiyaki was good but needed some time to cool off before eating and the tempura calamari is tempura calamari. No one should mess that one up.

Anyway, I'd come back here just to satisfy some sushi craving along with the pleasant and expedient service. By the way, the prices may be above average, but not by too much.

Lastly, if the check is paid in cash, there is a 10 percent discount.
author: Donn D.

description:
Fuji's needs a lot of help.  I will break it down as follows:

Service:  The young server could care less she seated us a dirty table without menus. We did not feel welcomed by any means.  Finally, I got up & went behind the counter and grabbed the menus.  She got the hint, and finally came to our table with a dirty gray rag and swirled around the food crumbs on the table.  Leaving us with the gross aroma of a filthy damp fungus smelling at our table. 

Cleanliness: Fuji's is simply dirty!  The tables are sticky and the chairs are sticky & dirty. The walls (next to the table) are filthy! Greasy and dry food stuck on the walls. The floors are dirty with napkins and food on the floor.
Windows are equally flithy!  Seriously, this place hasn't been cleaned or maintained well.  

Food:  Mediocre at best. Plus: Sushi and Sashimi just ok - overpriced.
Tempura is greasy and vegetables are over-cooked and soggy. Goza lacked flavor and greasy. 
Chicken terriyaki:  Chicken was fatty and the teriyaki lacked substance - almost watered down and certainly not enough on the chicken. So very weak.

Bottomline:  All of the above, give us many reasons to pause and wondered why would we ever recommend Fiji's or ever return for a meal.
author: A G.

description:
Got there at 6 and there were a few empty tables. About an hr later, the restaurant was packed! 

Anyways, pretty good sushi for the price. I love how they don't skimp you on the sashimi. Most places give thin cuts but not this place! 

Got the sushi/sashimi combo, double albacore, toro, and finding nemo. So filling for two people! Will definitely come back!
author: Cheryl P.

description: The restaurant had a very long wait time for the preparation of food (maybe because they wanted every dish on the table at once), but I was really hungry at the time, so lacked some patience. The waiters are nice, but I guess they have a really hard time seeing if the customers wanted something or is ready to order because I waited quite a while before my order was finally taken. The food is quite pricy, but it comes in a big portion and, I guess, flavor-wise it was worth the wait.
author: Angel N.

description:
Worst service ever. I was here again about a month ago and it still makes me mad thinking about how shitty the service was. It took like 30 minutes for me to get my food. Guess what I ordered..? ...........

.... One spicy tuna hand roll. You don't even need to cook it and it took freakin FOREVER!!!! my boyfriend got his salmon sashimi dinner set before I did and had to stare at his food for awhile while I was waiting for my food. 

I asked a waitress cuz I was getting angry and that's asking a lot from me since I'm usually nonconfrontational . And after I asked about it she brought it out. "Finally" I muttered underneath my breath while rolling my eyes. 

Water was never refilled as per my previous review. Food was great as always. Actually this is my bfs favorite sushi spot quality wise but now I shoot it down whenever he suggests it. SORRY..
author: Stephanie W.

description: This is hands down my favorite sushi spot in the city. They have many different selections of fish that are always very fresh. The toro and uni here never disappoints. Fuji has a large sake and beer selection to go with their amazing sushi. Some of my favorite dishes are the Gindara Miso (miso marinated black cod) hamachi Kama, and the liger roll. The prices here aren't cheap but it's definitely worth the money. Their portion sizes are huge and the quality is always up to par. They do get pretty packed esp on weekends but I've never had an issue with the service. All the staff are very friendly and accommodating, they seem to really care about their customers and the quality of their food. It's always a good experience and a fun time, thank you fuji for reopening !!
author: Edison P.

description: What kind of business closes 20 minutes before posted hours?  Their posted closing hour tonight was 9 P.M.  We checked in at 8:50 P.M. They still.had several occupied tables and turned down the business and said they wete already closed.  When I asked what time they close, they said 9 but really start closing at 840.  Lots of other Japanese restaurants around.   Don't need to try this one!
author: Bea Q.

description: Love this neighborhood gem!  Great appetizers and tasty sushi rolls.
author: Anne A.

description:
Out with the bestie making xmas gifts can definitely work up an appetite!  Both craving for some sushi, we decided to stop here based on Peter L.'s suggestion.  Even tho craving, I'm not a big fan of sushi dining on a Monday.  It makes me question their quality... cuz everyone knows the best & the fresh stuff arrives on Thursday, just before the weekend, but don't under estimate this resto.  Thanks to Peteo's suggestion, he's got this one spot on!

FOOD & TASTE:
Ordered the Hand Roll Sampler, which comes with 3 rolls your choice of fish.  I went for Hamachi, Salmon, & Salmon Skin.  The Hamachi was super fresh, large pieces of fish, rolled with avocado... creamy & delicious!  The Salmon was lean, (I usually like mine on the fattier side) was also rolled with avocado, very fresh, went well with the seasoned sushi rice.  

I also ordered Uni nigiri, which was topped with several Ikura.  I'm not a big fan of Ikura, since it's so salty, but it brought out a light "sea" like taste of the buttery uni.  It was so good I almost got another, but at $10.50 an order, I decided to pass. 

Also tried a few other items on the menu... Double Albacore roll, Sushi Sampler, Amaebi, all of which were very tasty!  Mos definitely got my fill of sushi craving.  :-9

CONVENIENCE: **** [Located in West Portal area, on a corner block closer to the Sloat Blvd. side. Street parking or metered spot.  Easy parking on a Monday.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Nothing fancy, just your average resto. Was informed of their upstairs, which is good for groups. Also, first impression reminds me of Korean spot, based menu design.. turns out to be Korean run.]
SERVICE: **** [Nice & friendly, though nothing stellar.]
PRICE: $$  [Be prepared to spend $30 & up per person. It's sushi.]
OVERALL: **** [4-stars... for serving fresh sushi on a Monday with good quality uni.]

Good locals' joint. 
Nuff said.

[#61 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description:
A nice little place in San Francisco. Fuji is my sister's mother-in-law's go-to sushi spot, so we decided to finally give it a try. I liked the Looking for Mango roll, but it wasn't outstanding. What I didn't like is that some of the rolls, like Double Albacore didn't have seaweed in them, you know the Nori, that keeps the rolls from falling apart? Apparently that wasn't a mistake, that's how they make them and that's why they fall apart.
Also, too much rice. I love rice, and I rarely leave any on the plate; in this place, I had to get rid of at least half the rice that they put on their rolls :(
author: Anna P.

description:
I've been to this place numerous times and I still find myself craving it all the time. 

The waitress here are attentive and sweet. They have a wide variety of fresh sushi sashimi daily. 
I love Uni and their Uni here is so yummy.

I would highly recommend trying the black cod and their Kumamoto oysters and their baked mussels as well. 

You already know you will be seeing me again!
author: Allie S.

description: Worst Japanese food ever. The food is not fresh and the service was not good. I wouldn't feed them to my donkey.
author: Anonymous C.

description: This place is a hidden gem. There are place where you walk in an you know you are in for a treat. This is one of those. Monday evening and I found plenty of parking in west portal. Next seated far away from the front of the door where the cold is. Orders taken and the food came out quick. Delicious mouthwatering. Can't wait to come back.  P.S. 10% off bill if you pay cash.
author: Jesse S.

description: The best special occasion is because I'm craving for Sashimi !!!  Even this place alittle pricy then my other sushi joints I go too..!! But it was worth every penny !!
author: Crisy G.

description:
We had the best waiter! Superior service by a most professional young man.
Four of us had lunch - all were impressed with quality of sushi, pricing and ambiance.
Have walked by this place for years- so glad we went in.
author: Kae D.

description:
Three of my friends and I came to Fuji for dinner at around 6 on a Saturday. The first floor was packed except for one table that would later be the place where my friends and I would be eating. We were greeted with a very unenthusiastic, irrashaimase, or welcome in English. Our order was taking by a rather unhappy looking Asian woman with black hair. She appeared grumpy and unhappy with serving the customers. This is definitely a bad note to start a meal off with if you ask me, however we later had an Asian male who gave us our meal who was very nice and friendly.

We soon received our edamame and seaweed salad which tastes good, however we soon noticed that the whole floor was being served by only two people. We waited about 25 minutes and received our food. I had ordered tonkatsu which is a port cutlet. It tasted very good and was displayed nicely. It came with a bowl of rice and miso soup which went very nicely with the tonkatsu. My friend's meals were also tasty and worth the money. 

My friends and I soon came to notice that there were a agglomeration of people just packed into the very confined spaces of the waiting area. It was rather odd seeing such a huge amount of people packed into such a small space. If you may not already know, Fuji has two floors, despite the huge amount of possible customers, we assumed that they weren't opening the 2nd floor because of the lack of servers and the effort required to travel up and down the stairs, the second waiter, a nicer Asian male, was already sweating when he came to bring us an extra spoon. The owner, later came to help serving, she was much kinder than the other server, most likely because it was her own business. She must have realized how understaffed the restraunt was, so she came out to try to lower the work for everyone. For the future, I would recommend for this restraunt to definitely higher more servers and to get people who are actually kind to their customers. In the end, the food was good, however the service was not really great and the people just watching you while you eat was a little odd. 

Tl;dr Food is good, service is not the best, appears to be understaffed
author: Gary L.

description: Love coming here whenever I crave sushi. It's in the west portal area but it isn't hard to find parking. Been coming here for years, the food and the staff never disappoints. Order the sashimi because it is always fresh! My favorite roll is definitely the Dinosaur Foot :) Can't find a similar roll anywhere else
author: Crystal C.

description: This place is great!  Sushi for days and the kitchen menu is pretty extensive.  Some of my faves are the hamachi kama, sashimi salad, sunomono salad, udon, ramen, ebi and hokkaido scallops!  A huge plus that it's in the neighborhood as well.
author: Belle P.

description:
I love this place!
I got the oshotashi, dinosaur foot and the finding nemo roll. Everything was great food wise.
The service could be a little better... But my server was very attentive and nice.
One of my favorite places for dinner!
author: Taylor R.

description:
The menus states that lunch ends at 4 o'clock on Saturdays however when we arrived at 330, there were 3 waiters, one was ringing up a customer at the counter where we were waiting to be seated.  The other two just literally stood and watched us.  It took about ten minutes and we were not immediately seated, once seated they walked away and took another ten minutes before asking what we'd like to order and then when we inquired about the lunch we were told at 3:50 that one wasn't going to be available that we are going to have to order from another menu.  THey jerked around with 20 minutes of our time, I was 8.5 months pregnant and with my elderly mother... it was not only unkind to make us stand for 10 minutes but also to make us wait that long only to deny us the lunch menu.

Needless to say we left and ate elsewhere.... if lunch ends at 4pm, then until that time we should be allowed to order... what a terrible game to try to play with customers time and money
author: Taz G.

description: There is a 10% off your bill for paying cash. I would give them 5 stars if I just rated the food. If you have a larger group, we had 5 adults and 2 toddlers, they might put you upstairs and be prepared for slow service. The food as most people have commented is pretty good. Sushi rolls I wouldn't say are out of this world as its just sushi rolls. The sashimi is pretty on point though. They give your nice size chunks of fish and it is nice and fresh. The bento box was pretty good. The only thing to complain about is that they need to go upstairs more often and refill drinks more. The iced tea is free refills and being super cheap I'd like someone to at least acknowledge when a drink gets low or empty and to pay attention to out of way customers. I will definitely be going back because there are some rolls that you don't see at other places. Of course places might make the same roll and just add one thing to change the name but I LOVE sushi and sashimi so I will be going back to try other rolls I haven't before like the dinosaur foot, linga roll and a few others. Maybe take a few trips but it's always better to go with more people to try more rolls. They take a max of 2 credit cards with $15 min, and the 10% off is also shown on your receipt. Guess that is a bit better than the 5% u get for credit card perks and its all the time. It is a bit small downstairs but make reservations and you'll be fine. Looking forward to returning. I assume if your downstairs the service is pretty good...we'll see for next time. EAT ON and be well!
author: Austin C.

description:
Like a fat kid who loves cake. Where in this scene, I'm the fat kid (Which I am) and the cake is the Sushi. I the fat kid has devoured the cake. Down to the last icing. 

Let's say not the Sushi, for this review, its the Sashimi.

I'm lazy as f@#k. So i just do what i always do and order the Sashimi Platter. 

MOst places usually you can't go wrong with it since almost every Japanese establishments have their sushi bar. To me...it helps me figure out the quality of their selection, food supplier and tells me how this very establishment does business. 

Ready? 

Fresh, Slippery and delicious..

Wait what chu mean breh?

Most japanese restaurants ive had the pleasure to dine in usually doesn't blow me away, I mean in fact usually I just eat the damn thing and go, "mmm, Okay"

This time i went "Holy jesus balls this is fresh."

Am I making this up? No, maybe i got lucky with a fresh batch they just got today...

Came back another week later...

MMmmhm...nope still tastes the same as i remember. That's great right?

NO WRONG! THAT SHOULDN'T BE THE CASE!!!

but it is. and I enjoyed it.

Sharon who was serving me the day I was there the first day has a very nice smile and makes you want to order A LOT. 

Lady, please stop talking with your sweet delicious words. I'm going to die from eating too much Japanese food.

Am I a foodie? not really, I just like to eat but usually the places that make me go wow? Sold.

#i'mnotbullshittingpleasegotryit.
author: Baylon Y.

description:
Came here many times with friends. I'm always happy to come to fuji. Every roll and dish is really good. Strongly recommend their deluxe sashimi. The deco is pretty and fish is really fresh, definitely high quality.
Wait steff was very attentive and friendly. She answers all questions about menu, sake and different types of sashimi. It was very helpful. 
Definitely come back here as usual!!!
author: Hy K.

description:
The place has recently changed ownership, and for the better! I have taste a difference in the food. Been coming here since I was a little kid, and it was always mediocre-good sushi. Now it's fantastic!
You can taste the freshness in the fish, and the flavors are incredible. Also in a quaint little spot in the heart of West Portal which makes for a cozy feel.

Great place!
author: Lauren G.

description: Took over an hr to be ready. started out ordering to go. was told it'd be done in 20 mins. went and got a drink at a nearby bar. went over a little late just to b sure it was ready. not only was it not ready, but they hadn't even started making yet! we stood and waited. we were even initially ignored by the first host/waiter.
author: Heidi B.

description:
3 star food, BUT horrible service and high prices knock it down.
