description: I'd give it a 5, but the poke (poki?) was really overpriced and subpar.  Not much fish, too much vegetation, and not that flavorful.  Having said all that, the spicy crunch roll, the Liger roll, and others were quite quite good.  I'd definitely go back.
author: SF Y.

description: Fuji is Korean owned, but I've found it better than most Japanese restaurants in this area, aside from Taravel Osaka.  It is good, especially at lunch time.   I enjoy their gyoza, tonkatzu, teriyaki dishes and their sushi is fresh.  Once the sushi chef gave me a sample of his tiny fried fish ~~~~ I wanted more!  Parking can be a challenge.
author: Marian G.

description: This used to be one of my favorite places to go while i was at  SF State. Not quite as good or as friendly as when Tom, their old sushi chef, worked there, but still a good choice. I definitely recommend the dinosaur foot to anybody going for their first time: a plate of four fried mint leaves, topped with tuna, tobiko, and I can't quite remember what else. Just try not to smoke too much pot before lunch/dinner as it's not exactly cheap and you might forget to feed the parking meter.
author: armando z.

description:
I have lived several blocks away from West Portal for 22 years. 
I am kicking myself for not trying Fuji earlier! 
The staff is extremely friendly. 
The rolls are unique, my favorite is the No Problem Roll ;-) 
My boyfriend (who is not a "sushi-lover") loved the dinner box that came with rice, salad, miso soup, goyza, shrimp & vegetable tempura, chicken teriyaki, and shashimi --- all for a reasonable price! 
We both loved this place and will come back very soon!
author: Frances J.

description: I've been here for lunch only. Decent place for when you need a quick sushi fix. Service is fast at lunchtime. The udon and agedashi tofu are good and the fish has been fresh everytime I've made a trip. I like their green tea (smooth, not bitter) which they refill efficiently.
author: Trinh T.

description:
you wont find whiteboard specials fed exed from tsukiji fish market nor 20 dollar blue ginersnap purple dragon cocktails. what you do find is good clean food, prepared with more care than most places and pretty decent service. i must have literally eaten here a hundred times or so and still till this date, i have not had a bad experience.  highly regarded neighborhood gem.

you must try this place if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Euge L.

description: We're always looking for a new place to try sushi at rather than our regular go to place.  It was a little pricey but the portion sizes are pretty big. For example I was surprised at how big the unagi was, not your typical little slice.    Tried one of their house special rolls which was the "Looking 4 a Mango" and to my surprise it was delicious. (shrimp tempura inside with tuna and mango outside) Also tried their  Bagel roll which is basically their version of the Philadelphia roll but bigger!  Place is also kid friendly because they even have special plastic cups for the kids.  No complaints with the service either.  Would give it another star if it wasn't for the price.
author: WinnJess E.

description: This spot is solid. The staff is friendly and the food is consistently good.
author: Manuel D.

description: Reliable and tasty. Prices are a little high, but it is convenient. Can be very busy on friday nights.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Due to its close proximity to my neighborhood, I tend to frequent this joint rather often when the urge strikes to sink my teeth into raw fish meat.  When seated at the bar, this place is lovely. The sushi chefs are friendly and fast and the fish is fresh (look at all those 'f' words!). HOWEVER, the boy and I had an experience at a table that I would not want to endure again:

7:30 - We are greeted at the door to a fairly empty Fuji. 
7:32 - We sit down and are given menus. 
7:35 - We have decided what we want, have put are menus down to signal that we are ready to order. 
7:40 - Nothing
7:45 - Time passes. Made eye contact with not one, but two servers. 
7:50 - Not a word from a server. Fuji remains empty. Crickets chirp. Stomach growls. 
7:55 - Go up to the counter and ask if I should order with her or if someone will serve us. Becoming hungrier. 
7:56 - Am told to have a seat. I catch the eye of aforementioned cricket and contemplate dipping it in soy. Stomach growls to advise against it. 
8:00 - Boyfriend is HANGRY (hungry+angry) and wants to leave. 
8:05 - "Fuck this", we chant in unison. We decide to move to the bar. 
8:10 - We are greeted by the SUPER NICE sushi chef, given a menu and place an order. 
8:15 - We are scarfing down roll upon roll upon roll, trying to forget about the (almost) hour we spent waiting. 

We left full, slightly annoyed, swearing we wouldn't come back. The bad taste in our mouth was definitely left by the service, though, for the sushi was delicious. Time has gone by and we have visited several times. ALWAYS sit at the bar!
author: haley d.

description: They know their rolls, but there other stuff on the menu is very blah. The beef terriyaki was overpriced with its tiny portion. $18 for a thin piece of meat that was about the size of my hand. The tempura batter was so, so. MUST EAT mango roll, it is the best roll on the menu. I love the fresh taste of mango with the roll, it sounds weird but must try. If you like spicy than you should also try the Firecracker Roll, yummy and crispy.
author: Erica B.

description: I had dinner here about a month ago on a Wednesday night with a co-worker of mine.  We were in the mood for Japanese and, apparently, he frequents Fuji a lot.  We spent a lot of time chatting so every time the waitress came to take our order, we weren't ready yet.  We didn't order too much from what I remember.  I think we ordered the Rainbow Roll, the Unagi Roll, and one more that I can't remember.  It was plenty for the two of us and it tasted good.  That's all you can really ask for.  We were there around 6pm and there wasn't wait, but there was definitely a wait by the time we left around 8pm.
author: Kris L.

description: Came here with a friend because we were in the mood for some sushi. It was my first time coming here and I have to say that we had a great time! The waitress seated us promptly and gladly took our order! We ordered a lot of food and alcohol, too. Oh boy! What a night it was! The rolls were delicious especially the one I ordered called Finding Nemo (salmon and avocado = yum).  We were sooo full and sooo buzzed by the end but we had a good time! Minus one star for being a bit pricey but I would definitely come back again! :)
author: Mel P.

description: HORRIBLE.  The fish here is old as hec.  It is so damn chewy its like bubblegum!@# .  But you wouldn't really know this if you order the rolls cause all the extra things like rice, avocado, sauces, frying, etc., masks the old fish.  Believe me, my brother works at a sushi restaurant and so he knows all the little tricks they use to pass off old fish and i'm sure Fujis is probably practicing some of those methods.  But that ain't hate, its just the truth about places like Fujis that need to do what they gotta do to survive, especially nowadays.  So you want cheap sushi that tastes ok because the oldness of the fish is masked by aaaalllll that saucy stuff and fried stuff, then go here.  You want quality fish then you gotta pay for it at one of those high end places in S.F, or go to Osakas in Davis.
author: paul k.

description: a good place, small but intimate and comfortable. very decent quality, friendly japanese staff, ( getting to be more unusual than you might think and important if you want real Japanese food)easy parking...been there several times and not disappointed
author: Paul F.

description: This place has some of the best non-sushi Japanese food that I have had. I would recommend the Korean style chirashi, the  miso glazed black cod or the taro chips with tuna and avocado.
author: Matt L.

description: I have tried Fuji a couple of times, but mainly I have found that the sushi here is just ok and that the prices are really high. I don't really plan on going back.
author: J F.

description: Really decent sushi, but just another ordinary sushi place.  I wasn't disappointed.  I may go back for the Onkimo, was the best I've had since Saito's in Seattle.  They do have some interesting Rolls on their board.
author: Roger M.

description: We have eaten in Japanese restaurants in west portal before and hadn't tried this place before, so we thought we would give it a shot. Big mistake. We are in our early twenties and were by far the youngest people in the place so we are guessing that is why we got such horrible service. We were seated pretty quickly, but once we were seated we were completely forgotten about. Which was strange considering EVERY time the waiter/waitress had to take an order somewhere they had to pass by us. We had waited over 30 minutes without having our order taken, so we finally had to wave someone down to even get our drink orders taken. Once they were taken though- back to being forgotten. Thirty minutes later, no food. So we ask whats going on considering others that came later than us already were done eating. They said they would check, never came back. Food never came, so we left. Definitely never going back either, wouldn't recommend it to anyone either.
author: Mindy T.

description: I stumbled in this place with a lovely companion and we braved a new sushi spot,  it was a nice experience.  We stuck to the specials,  which were all very good.  The staff was friendly and the price was reasonable.
author: Doug D.

description: Really good sushi with lots of "different" styles of sushi but all really good. Open kind of late and the wait is never really bad. Overall, good eats in West Portal
author: Bree V.

description: I love this place!!! The sushi is delicious and the staff is awesome, it's a great place to bring a date or just hang out with friends.
author: B K.

description: Absolutely supurb sushi!! If I could afford it I would eat here everyday. The unagi roll and katsudon are some of the best I've ever tasted, and I love to wash it down with some imported Ginger ale. Yum!!! Unfortunately the service keeps me from giving this place five stars. I am a very patient person, but I often feel I have to wait for an eternity just to get a glass of water. The ambience feels very nice, food is delicious, service understaffed.
author: Christian C.

description: I ate here for the first time today never having heard of it before and never having looked it up yelp like I normally would.  What a great place.  I'll definitely be back.  It is a little bit pricier than many Japanese places and the sushi was great but not the best I've ever had but the other dishes were awesome.  I also appreciated that the spicey tuna roll actually had a little kick to it.  Very cute place, I loved it.
author: Tom F.

description: I thought the sushi was good, but it was kind of expensive for some rolls. The owner is an ass though. They don't even bring out water until I finished my roll.
author: Kim T. N.

description: I have been to this restaurant for many times. Every time when I am there, I was there only because I was hungry and did not want to look for another place to go. They prepare food. They don't serve food. There is no service. This last time when I was there, it was horrible. Not to mention that there was no service. The food was terrible. The plate was big, the portion was small. Every time when I was there, asking for more hot tea was like pulling teeth. Did I mention there was no services. Really disappointing.
author: James C.

description:
when i used to ride muni during my ventures in and around the city during my run at sfsu many moons ago, the K line was one of the lines that i took which took me through west portal. nice little neighborhood where the dogs walk their owners and there are absolutely almost no kids around....weird..   so going to fuji was like walking down memory lane. 

small little corner restaurant with huge windows. i likes already. we chose to sit at the sushi bar and greet the chef. went thru the menu and googoo gaga over the pictures of the rolls. its all so pretty looking.  i wanted to order everything, then i see the prices.  but gosh, where else can you get a roll topped with mango (looking 4 mango) or something called a liger? super special.

being adventurous with food, i wanted to try this one roll they had.  well, i ordered 2 rolls...i dont remember the names of them (excuse to go back i guess). but one of the rolls i wanted to try was one that had "raw meat on top of a hamachi roll, with cucumber and carrots, topped sesame".  like woah.. raw meat? serious? the bf looks at me with that "yea, good luck with that one" kind of look. whatever. i already tried uni back in the day.. which isnt a favorite in my book. ill just say it's "interesting" and has an "interesting" texture. anyway, the raw meat wasnt really raw. they had seared the paper thin slices of meat and let it cook and cool while the chef prepped the roll. it's actually not a bad roll. and it's not raw at all. *whew* 

now i wanted to try escolar (aka super white)but the FDA branch is a floor below me and they've got some info on that fish.  so i pass. the chef says its an oily fish because i was staring at some of the escolar nigiri he was making. tempting..but i passed this time around.

to finish off we ordered the fried bananas with green tea ice cream. nice selection of ice creams to choose from though.. green tea, red bean, ginger, vanilla, mango, sesame.  served our dessert in a martini glass, with whipped cream and a cherry on top. mmmm sexy. 

fuji is a cool place with a great selection of special rolls.. the prices..well, its not that pretty, but the creativeness makes up for it plenty.
author: Summer R.

description: This place rules for sushi. They have a great selection of nigiri keeping it to the basics the way good sushi should be. The prices are in line with where they should be. They do have a good selection of specialty roles that go beyond the fried shrimp phenomenon for those interested in spicing things up a bit. The staff is very friendly and chatty. I am pleased that it is out in West Portal because you do not need a reservation and they are easily accommodating even for large groups. Oh fishy fish, I will be back for more.
author: Alicia J.

description: I've eaten here several times and really can't figure out why this place is always packed when there are so many other great sushi places so close by!  Yes, Fuji has a cute atmosphere, but every time I've eaten here, something's been a little bit not quite what I wanted.   Fella had some scales on his fish that kinda skeeved him out, I've gotten some rolls that aren't quite stuck together right and fell apart when I picked them up, and the edamame last time was actually kind of slimy, gross and flavorless. All in all, I've had better luck at Suki Sushi across the street, or Kamakura a few blocks down.
author: Kri B.

description: Fuji is my favorite sushi place in San Francisco. I eat here at least once a month. I highly recommend the Godzilla roll, which is maguro  wrapped around asparagus with grilled garlic. It is my favorite ever. The Red & White roll is also to die for. It is a spicy tuna roll topped with an amazing salad. The Looking for Mango roll is a great desert roll.  I always sit at the sushi bar, and the sushi chefs are very social, friendly, and funny. I went here on Valentines day this year, and they gave me and my friend TWO bottles of sake for free! Score!
author: Jamie J.

description:
this is one of my favorite sushi joint to go.

my favorite is red and white roll, and dinner box 3 i think, the one with chicken yakitori and tempura, eggplant dengaku, california roll, salad, rice, and misosoup. aand of course with a cold one. mmmm.

Their rolls are awesome. I just looove the creativeness and oh they taste so good. my roommate never eat sushi, but she liked their rolls, that means a lot.
author: chihiro i.

description:
I go to this neighbourhood place pretty often,. ever since they updated the menu, it has been great. 
Favorite sushi rolls: double albacore and lion king. 
fish is fresh 

This is not a fancy place, but a great spot for casual lunch or dinner.
author: klarissa c.

description: Fab neighborhood sushi restaurant in West Portal! Fish is super fresh.  Great daily specials.  Friendly chefs.  Try Dinosaur Foot!
author: Michelle M.

description:
one of the best sushi joints in this city. great philly roll & i'm such a sucker for their spicy tuna roll. they are very generous with the tea. service is always great even though there is rarely more than once server. 

& now i am really craving sushi. is 5 times a week too many?
author: Lizzy L.

description: I love this place. Really close to where I live. Reasonably priced and two words. Dinosaur Foot. You will not be sorry.
author: Mark G.

description: This place is absolutely FABULOUS!   Went here with my friends that live in West Portal.  Talk about mouth watering.....ummm.....taste so good when it touched my lips.  The firecracker & lion king roll so fn good.   Chicken Teryaki was moist & yummy too.
author: Natacha M.

description: This place has the freshest sushi in town and a great selection of sake. And I eat sushi everywhere in the country from Hawaii to Nobu in NYC so I have some persprective. The staff is extremely nice. I have had much higher priced sushi of lesser quality at some of the big names in SF. I get there early sometimes just to get a seat because it can get busy.
author: DENNIS C.

description: I stopped in for a late lunch, feeling the need to treat myself to place I've sp many times. It was heaven, the best sushi experience I've had in SF thus far. Granted my budget restricts me Hotel Nikko keeping all this in mind I had wonderful service from the chef who was friendly and they gave me samples of various things the rolls were so well executed, and the tempura was so light and crispy. As I prefer a more peace and quiet sushi experience the timing could not have been better almost empty. But I'm quite sure there is a dinner rush. West Portal has a lot of charm and Fuji is perfectly at home there.
author: crystal j.

description: The service is very goood. I showed up 10 minutes before lunch was over and they didn't make me feel rushed at all. The food wasn't bad, but it isn't the kind of place I get urges for (example: Jo's sushi in Pleasant Hill). I like places that have more than a couple of non-seafoodroll options.
author: Rachel B.

description: This is my favorite local sushi place.  They do some really creative things with their rolls.  My favorite roll is the Dinosaur Foot.  The staff is always very friendly although service can be slow.  I have never had anything bad here.
author: Michelle M.

description: I came here last night with my friend after finally deciding what to eat for dinner since we're very indecisive. I ordered the Box 1 for dinner, which was pretty good overall. I tried some of my friends sushi that she got, and it wasn't bad... Fuji's make me not want to ever go to any Chinese-operated sushi restaurants because this place is GOOD. I will come back again.
author: Edgar G.

description: MMmMmMmMmmmhhh..... So, this is where I got turned out on sushi!  I have tried other places in the city, but this is the one I am going to be faithful too.  The staff there is awesome and the food comes with a quickness.... who could ask for more?
author: Nora O.

description: Tasty sushi, fast service, and they even let us order 5 min before they were about to close!!  If ever in the West Portal, check it out!
author: Tara F.

description: I'm no expert on Sushi (and still timid when ordering it), but I've been here  many times  and the food is always great. My boyfriend and I tried the tempura shrimp, the teriyaki chicken, and 2 rolls, the entrees came with rice, miso soup, and salad...all very good. Oh, and they served the entrees with a slice of watermelon, an orange and a few slices of pickled radish. Yummy food, clean place, prompt service. My only problem (which isn't even much of a "problem") would be the ambiance.
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description: Yummy food, check.  The teriyaki chicken, katsu chicken, teriyaki salmon and sushi is tasty.  However, the space factor does put a hamper on things.  They do take reservations, but the space is pretty cramped, nonetheless.  I like the escolar sushi.
author: brenda b.

description:
yum yum. we ordered a bunch of the special rolls, sashimi and sake bombs. not sure if the rolls were amazing because I was drunk or it really was delicious.

The liger roll is great if you like saucy rolls. Also a big fan of the dragon foot roll. My friends are really into sashimi and thought the rainbow trout was 'to die for.' we also got some raw oysters which were pretty good.

this place was good, we also managed to rack up a $200 bill between 4 people.
author: elissa w.

description: Super nice little quaint place on the edge of west portal. Servers are nice, and the food is great. I tend to eat a lot here, so be expected to pay around 40 dollars to feel like you got a decent meal. If you've got more than 4 people to a table, try calling in advance. Save yourself the headache of waiting outside the restaurant.
author: Clinton L.

description:
my friends love this place (like on a first-name basis with the sushi chefs kinda thing). me, i think it's good, and a fine place to fill up on on fish and sake and beers. (while reading, remember i'm a bit of a sushi snob. so take it all with a grain of salt...and perhaps a shot of sake).

the best thing about my most recent visit? discovering that my friend kf is as much of a sushi freak as i am. this could be an expensive discovery...  

kf wasn't impressed by the amaebi, but it seemed fine to me--no old oil flavor, nice and hot and crispy. oh and the raw bit? eh, i'm always more interested in the fried bit (is that sacrilegious?). 

the unagi was huge, tender and delicious. the sea bass had a great slightly chewy consistency and great flavor (i like the sturdier fish, so i like chewy). the hamachi was ok. not the best i've had, but not the worst. the toro (i.e. our dessert) was pretty good. not to die for, but a nice finish.

the escolar was too cold. yep, frigid. i started to inhale it, was dismayed to notice the chill coming off the fish onto my teeth, and put it down to reach room temp. at which point it was lovely--good flavor, nice texture...

the uni (my first try at uni! i'm hooked!) was good. nice oceany flavor, definitely mushy, not knowledgeable enough to know if this was super fresh, but i'll definitely learn more as soon as i can.

our friend got a couple of the rolls...i wasn't tempted by any of them. there was one that had banana--heard it was a bit sweet, and might've been better as a desert. the sake was quite nice, and the service was friendly and efficient (yeeeah to my peeps).

next time i'm out drinking in the castro with kf, i'd definitely hop on muni to get a sushi fix in west portal...
author: eliza w.

description: fuji's sushi is pretty expensive but their cooked sushi is yummy. their sashimi on the other hand is nothing spectacular. i had the chirashi and it was small and just ok. again not as great as the place in fremont. if i were to go back again for a third time it would be just for their cooked sushi.
author: Helen L.

description: Place was pretty good.  Honestly, any place that gives me a nice size cut of hamachi sashimi will win me over.
author: David O.

description: The fish tastes fresh.  The rolls are farely creative.  You've got to try the "Godzilla roll" (cliche name, but new and wonderful tastes!)!  Decent pricing.  I don't recomend the noodle bowls.  They're kinda bland.  Unfortunately, the service here sucks.  The wait staff is thoroughly inefficient (very un-Japanese), making multiple pass-by's with no check in's. I have to tell you that I was in for lunch.  If I didn't know any better, the sushi chef was laughing at me.  There was an actual moment when I had to ask, "is that roll [that's been sitting on the counter for the past fucking ten minutes] mine?"  and guess what?  It was.  It's really an unfortunate thing.  The food is actually pretty good and the prices are so-so, but goddammit, if it wasn't for the shitty service!
author: Darkie L.

description: Fuji is my favorite spot for sushi other than blowfish, which is super pricey.  The rolls at Fuji are very inventive.  Just the other night I ordered the So Happy Together roll, which had tempura shrimp, cream cheese, mango, banana, and strawberry on top.  Weird but yummy.  I also love the Dinosaur Foot.  It's a deep-fried leaf of some sort with spicy tuna piled on top.  I had the Firecracker roll.  it was a very tasty roll with regular tuna and spicy tuna, served with a salad and a bit of some kind of dressing on top.  I took my friend here for the first time and she absolutely loved it.
author: Kandi K.

description: All I have to Say Is f ing RIP OFFF RIP OFFF UNless U plan to spend $60 dollars minimum for dinner with a full stomach, don't come here . everyone knows sushi is a bunch of small portioned overepriced yet yummi scaming.
author: david t.

description: I challenge anyone here to find a better sushi restaurant.  Quite simply the quality of the fish is incredible, and I've yet to find it's match.
author: Tasha S.

description: I went back last week and got the Red and White roll. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! It takes over the Godzilla Roll as my favorite dish at Fuji. MMMM.
author: Erica M.

description: Large variety of rolls with some interesting (and at times just odd) flavor combos. Nigiri pieces seem generous.  No good place to wait for a table if you choose not to sit at the sushi bar.
author: Christopher K.

description: Excellent teriyaki, and tempura.  I have never had the Sushi there but the CA rolls are good.  The only problem is the service, alittle slow and they need to be better at seating people.  If you are coming at a peek time make a reservation!
author: Kevin C.

description: I have been a sushi lover since the day I was born, I will try any type of sushi, any time of day at any price.  I have been to numerous sushi restaurants in my life and Fuji Sushi really does sushi well. The dinosaur foot is my staple when going to this restaurant, but you can never go wrong with anything you order.  The magro sushi is out of this world and the portions for the sushi pieces are as big as any two portions at other sushi restaurants.  The sushi comes out fast and the staff is encouraging and has been able to pick up on my favorites and recommend others that I always love.  Their green tea ice cream with fried banana is really something else! All of their rolls are gorgeous but taste even better, and I always leave there stuffed to the brim.  Since the first time I ate at Fuji, no other sushi has come close to the amazing, mouthwatering, savory dishes that I have ordered at this restaurant. I whole-heartedly recommend this spot to anyone and everyone. Mmm getting hungry just thinking about it.
author: Bria G.

description: I had the cherry blossom roll, the maguro was cut a little thick for my taste but the quality was great. I think their miso soup was one of the best I've had and the atmosphere was really cozy, staff very friendly and fun. This will definately be my regular sushi spot from now on.
author: Perri B.

description: Not too shabby. Went here on a date and we were the first to arrive for dinnertime, so we got great service at the start of the meal. Tasty tea, and the sushi and chicken teriyaki were good. Service started to lack in quality as it got busier, but that's to be expected when the restaurant is packed. I would go back; I love to go out to eat in West Portal.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Great sushi! Im always scared to eat actual raw sushi but that changed when I took a risk and ate some sashimi here.  I seriously craved it all week and went back twice within the next two weeks.  The service is good not great but everyone is really nice.

The sushi is fresh and delicious!!! great non raw sushi as well but everything is just delicious and will definitely leave you satisfied!!!

if you arent one for raw sushi defintely try the lion king rolls and the firecracker rolls!!!

Go try this place you wont be dissapointed!
author: Chelsey L.

description:
Went for takeout on a Tuesday night, and it was packed. Good sign.

It's a little pricey, but portions are very generous. We had the Looking For Mango roll and the West 14th roll. LOVED the West 14th; good level of spice, not too saucy, nice crunchy wakame and tobiko. I'm not a huge fan of tempura, but the Looking For Mango was very good, too.

I'll probably go back, but probably not that often. I'd like to sit at the sushi bar and just follow the chef's recommendations, assuming I could actually get a seat.
author: Nicole A.

description: We LOVE Fuji sushi!  This is the regular sushi spot for my husband and I.  You can't go wrong here.  The prices are totally reasonable for sushi and the fish is always fresh.  We love their fun rolls too, like "Looking for Mango".  SO yummy!
author: Diana B.

description: I love this place! Great sushi, hardly ever a wait for a table and great service. It also has none of the pretensions of the hipper places and I think it is just as good. The double albacore roll is my favorite roll, but I usually order sashimi and nigiri. yum!
author: Claudia M.

description: I'm not gonna lie to you the service is not good. But the food is amazing. The sushi chefs are are wizards I sware. Some of their combinations sound a little wierd but they taste so good. You must try I'm looking for mango, banana split,godzilla roll, and dinosaur foot. I reccomend sitting at the bar because you'll get way better service from the sushi chefs then you will from the waitresses.
author: Sushi K.

description: This is a lovely neighborhood Japanese restaurant.  I love sashimi and skim on sushi to cut down on my white rice intake and find Fuji to be reliable.  The menu is basic, extensive, and a bit pricey (new menu, new wait staff), but the food is fresh and delicious.  I'm shortening the rating to four stars because the current wait staff discouraged me from ordering sashimi a la carte and steered me toward the sashimi appetizer--and no substitutions.  Perhaps this was a new waiter.  Service may seem unfriendly to some but they turn over tables as quickly as they can.
author: M.D. L.

description:
Maybe they aren't as creative and hip as some places but my wife and I used to eat there regularly and they were consistently very good.  The service is okay not great but not bad either.

In five years, I don't think we had a bad piece of fish.
author: Matt T.

description: This is a cute little place.. its like your own neighborhood Japanese restaurant.... Its small and it fills up fast.. we arrived there right when it opened and before i knew it the place was packed.. im a really picky sushi eater and they totally made me exactly what i wanted... i dont get too crazy when it comes to sushi.. so i had them make me shrimp tempura with just cucumbers and rice paper because im not a fan of the seaweed... ewww.. i know how nonjapanese of me but im hella white! sorry! keith ate this craziness sushi with raw tuna and asparagus tempura and all types of other strange stuff.. he f-in loved it! the child ate all of them in less than 5 mins... i think it made his night... this place is close to keith's house and we walked there which was great because we didnt feel all nasty and full when we got back home because we walked it off!  cant wait to come back again.. ive been dreaming about my shrimp rolls.. i think im going to order two... how big girl status of me!
author: Ashley M.

description: I will never come here unless it is Thursday why you ask. It's the only day for half off beer and sake. The food is great and service could be better although Thursday is my only go to day.
author: Kevin N.

description: This spot is my favorite sushi in the city.  Staff is very friendly and helpful, your saki will be at your table within one minute of ordering, the food comes fast, water is always full,  all around excellent dining experience every time.
author: Ryan M.

description: I'm starting to notice that I eat a lot of sushi.  In fact, I think I've had sushi 4 out of 7 days this week.  In fact it's what I'm craving this very minute.  And yesterday evening, around 6pm, when I had that same craving, I wandered down to West Portal (which is near my hood) and tried the place I've been meaning to try for the last several years.  I went by myself (my sushi craving before I could find a buddy to join me) and sat down in a near empty restaurant (it was a Sunday).  I quickly received my menu and tea, and I quickly ordered the two rolls I decided on.  One was a mango something or other, and the other was called Omega 3(?).  The mango was a little too sweet for me, the terriyaki sauce put it over the top.  But the Omega 3 was really good.  The service was good... my tea cup was never empty, and the check came quickly when I asked for it.  They even brought out a little orange all pretty and cut up to finish off the meal.  I'll definitely go back!  Though I'll stay away from the rolls with terriyaki sauce on them.
author: Luba M.

description: One of my favorite sushi joints! They have the best miso soup.. and I'm very picky about my miso soup.. The red and white roll is amazing but they also have really amazing nightly specials.
author: sarah s.

description: I want to like this place, but having tried it now a few times cannot recommend it unless you live in the West Portal neighborhood. For a neighborhood sushi place it's ok, but not worth seeking out otherwise. Large selection of rolls, but nothing remarkable or memorable. Nevertheless, one of your better options on dreaded West Portal Ave.
author: Brad M.

description: I finally tried this place tonight, and I'm glad I did. It wasn't the best Japanese food experience I've ever had, or even one of the top 5 but it did the job of satisfying my sushi craving. The staff is also very friendly and attentive. The sushi tasted very fresh. Next time I'd like to get something that includes more. All I can really go by is the Rainbow Roll that I ordered. The only criticism I have is the menu that they offer...I was hoping they would have some more affordable dinner combinations, like a sushi roll or two with a salad and miso. But the closest thing they had to that costs like $20, which was more than I intended to spend. But all in all, I really enjoyed the service and the convenience. I would go back.
author: L. Renee D.

description:
This is the best Sushi Bar I have ever been too! My now husband and I moved here 4 years ago and continue to eat a new sushi bars across the city but keep coming back to Fuji! We even had our wedding reception their! 

When you walk in you are greeted by the chefs and the owner with a boisterous, "Hello" in Japanese and seated. It's a small place with room to add more upstairs but my favorite seat is at the bar where you can watch the chefs expertly compose flavor combinations that I have only found at Fuji. Friday and Saturday evenings tend to be busy and but if you go for lunch any day, you will find it cozy and not overcrowded. The food is fantastic, I haven't really found a roll that I thought was bad, although some flavor combinations are out of this world, like the fresh lemon and mint leaf on their 49er roll. You will pay a little more here than at some other sushi joints but the quality and freshness of the ingredients is unmatched. I would recommend anyone to this restaurant who wants to try flavors that knock you off your feet. Also, I recommend trying the Garlic Albacore, it's not on the menu, but as my favorite chef once put it, "It's very sexy!" Enjoy!
author: Nichja H.

description: We had the beef sukiyaki and the una tem roll (shrimp tempura, unagi, avocado) and the bagel roll (philly cheese and salmon).  All of the food was very tasty and beautifully presented.  The server was super nice and the owner came over to make sure our dinner was nice.  The restaurant is clean and very warm.  We had all this and a tall kirin for $54.
author: Brian L.

description: I had a very nice experience here.  The sushi was fresh, the staff friendly.  It's a great week-night dinner place.  Yummy albacore with garlic!  Okay ambiance.
author: Stephanie E.

description: just average. a few fun special rolls but otherwise i'd say west portal still lacks a killer sushi joint.
author: hunter w.

description: What a disappointment.  I was so prepared for a delicious sushi dinner, but I ended up with a terrible and overpriced meal.  I am told that the food here usedto be really good, but then the restaurant changed hands, and verything went downhill.  The crab roll tasted like water mixed with a bit of windex and the wasabi tasted like soe sort of detergent.  The beef teriyaki was okay, but the portion was so small that it was barely worth it.  And it was like $40 for all of this.  I must say, avoid fuji. Thre are way better places to get sushi around town.
author: Kirk J.

description:
Well, wife and I have eaten here a few times when we're craving sashimi and want something quick. Needless to say, it's been decent most of the time.
The service is actually pretty bad. Yesterday, my in-laws, along with my wife and our 9 month old, went for dinner and sat upstairs since the bottom was pretty full.
When the bill came, they had the nerves to already include 18% gratuity. I asked the lady why this was included and she stated that it's standard practice for parties of 5 or more. I told her that our infant doesn't count and that it's BS. I concluded that the only reason she did this was because she had to walk up and down the flight of stairs to bring us our food. I've gone numerous times with another couple who have a infant as well and we were never charged this.
Needless to say, I told them to leave it on the bill. I guess they'd rather have a few dollars in their pockets now instead of a steady stream from a returning customer. Don't get me wrong, I would of tipped them generously, it's the principle of the matter.
Oh well, back to EBISU!

Cheers
author: diewney n.

description: Had the sushi nigiri and tempura lunch special and was very pleased with the freshness of the sushi.  The meal came with the standard miso soup and house salad. Soup was not salty and the dressing was tasty.  Service was attentive and quick.  No complaints and would return again when I'm in the area.
author: sasaw A.

description: I love the chef's special sushi. I use to go there all the time. They have fresh fish and I never worry about getting sick from bad fish. The people are really nice too. Their bento boxes are nice, my friend usually orders it. I go for the fresh fish. Yum. I salvate just thinking about it.
author: bob k.

description: If I could give this place a lower rating, I would. The service started off lousy. It was as if hey had never dealt with customers, and presented themselves as two faced, right over our shoulders no less. My Girlfriend and I went here base on the previous recommendations on the site. What  a mistake.  We ordered three rolls, which at any other Japanese restaurant I've ever been too should have made me explode, but in this case left me hungry and broke. If you are willing to pay $13.00 for a piece of deep fried asparagus and a sliver of tuna cut into five tiny pieces, be my guest. Rip off. The next roll was all right, but again, tiny. Finally, we gave up on the "Highly recommended"  "crazy-sounding" rolls, and opted for a simple roll known as the bagel roll. A piece of tuna, green onion and cream cheese. If there was fish in there, I couldn't taste it at all. Sounds simple right? Now I see just how great my favorite places are. Kane in Danville makes this place look like the lunch counter at Safeway.
author: Chris H.

description: WHAT HAPPENED??!!!  This used to be our favorite sushi bar, until a few months ago when something happened.  All the sushi chefs "quit", according to our new waitress--some who have been there almost 10 years.  Service has gone downhill too, and the portions have become smaller.  On two occasions, we left after waiting almost 15 minutes without any service.  It's a shame to see such a great restaurant come on bad times.  Save your money and head to Ebisu or Hamano.
author: Frannie R.

description: The salmon and albacore were tender, fresh and shiny. Dishes with spicy tuna in them had a good kick. The Dragon Foot is a tasty novelty, with a deep fried shiso leaf beneath spicy tuna, daikon and daikon sprouts. The service was attentive, the staff smiling and friendly. The portions were good size and well prepared. I don't return to sushi restaurants where the sushi falls apart, but I'll definitely be returning to Fuji.
author: Robert W.

description: Really high quality Japanese food here. Good, friendly service, excellent selection and nice atmosphere. The fire cracker here is one of the best things I've ever eaten. Yes it is a tiny bit more expensive than some other sushi places, but it is unquestionably worth it. When you're looking for a place to eat raw food, shouldn't the quality be more important than a few extra bucks?
author: Ryan B.

description: the first time i came here was last year, after a superlong pre-wedding pampering session with my sister-in-law's bridal party at zen beauty day spa & lounge (323A west portal ave), and we were so ravenous afterward (relaxing sure builds up an appetite!) that we went to town at fuji.  so i figured that after an evening of pedis at zen (the "spa" salon at 221A not the lounge) we would have another fab feast at fuji...alas, zen salon did not live up to the hype of zen lounge, and neither did the meal seem as memorable.  granted, 6:30 in the evening is the peak for the dinnertime rush, so i was surprised they could seat us so quickly.  then again, they sat the 3 of us at a 2 person table that was still littered with bits of rice and splatters of soy sauce from the mom & toddler who had just left...not a good start!  they were quick to clean up (but not quite thorough) and to their credit, they offered to move us when a larger table opened up; service was attentive on & off throughout the evening.  sushi was, fortunately, as good as i remember (try the godzilla & liger - no not tiger, Liger - rolls) and the teriyaki portions my girlfriends ordered were huge.  fried banana/green tea ice cream seems to be the de rigeur dessert at most asian restaurants, but here they sliced the bananas up and fried them in panko bread crumbs rather than tempura batter - different, but still good.  (banana katsu anyone?)  all in all, good food, eh service.  but the girls & i can catch up anywhere and have a fun night!
author: Jen P.
